<<<<<<< HEAD
The military garden, or instructions for all young souldiers and such who are disposed to learne, and have knowledge of the militarie discipline. ... Observed and set in order according to the best military practice by Iames Achesone gentleman at armes, burges of Edinburgh Achesone, James.
[4], 36 p., plate
Printed by Iohn Wreittoun, Edinburgh : anno Dom. 1629.
At foot of title: Cum privilegio Regali. The plate is a folding typographic diagram of battle formations. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

[4], 36 p., plate
Printed by Iohn Wreittoun, Edinburgh : anno Dom. 1629.
At foot of title: Cum privilegio Regali. The plate is a folding typographic diagram of battle formations. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Iohn Wreittoun
